Cafe de Coral, Hong Kong

Home > Asia > China > Hong Kong > Hong Kong Restaurants > Cafe de Coral
All 3,373 Hong Kong Restaurants» Cafe de Coral Times Square, Causeway Bay , Hong Kong , China Ranked #285 of 3,373 restaurants in Hong Kong 68 Reviews Price range: $3 - $6 Dining options: Breakfast/Brunch, Late Night 23 visitor photos Restaurant details Dining options: Breakfast/Brunch, Late Night Update restaurant details Write a Review 68 reviews from our community 56% Recommend Excellent 15 Very good 24 Average 22 Poor 5 Terrible 2 Rating summary Food Service Value Atmosphere 68 reviews sorted by Date Rating Chinese (Traditional) first English first Spanish first Any SassyTraveller111 London, United Kingdom Senior Reviewer 10 reviews Reviews in 6 cities “Whampoa Gardens branch Kowloon.” Reviewed July 12, 2012 NEW We love this restaurant! We have been to a few of these both in Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and always find them great. The food is really good and reasonably priced and in the Whampoa Gardens branch the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. One lovely girl working there had a chat with us and was very helpful in... More Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 3 more reviews by SassyTraveller111 for Hong Kong Girlseatworld Ellicott city, md Contributor 15 reviews Reviews in 10 cities “I wish there was one in DC!” Reviewed July 10, 2012 NEW How I miss Cafe de Coral. They are a fast food chain in Hong Kong and their food selection changes often and the price and varieties are great. I love their Bake Pork Chop dish and the baked pasta in bolognese sauce. And a set lunch price is around US$4. They also have afternoon tea, breakfast and dinner. Something from... More Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? Dustin H Hong Kong, China Contributor 15 reviews Reviews in 2 cities “Cheap good eats” Reviewed July 6, 2012 NEW I tell my friends...eat at Cafe de coral. You will love it! And visitors to HK always do love the food and the price. Recommended: Char Siu or the fabulous baked pork chop. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 12 more reviews by Dustin H for Hong Kong Demon D GuangZhou Senior Reviewer 7 reviews Reviews in 3 cities “convenience and standard” Reviewed July 1, 2012 it's quite convenience, cheap, and provides standard foods. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 2 more reviews by Demon D for Hong Kong daren33 Singapore, Singapore Senior Reviewer 6 reviews Reviews in 4 cities “picture of food portion are misleading” Reviewed June 29, 2012 picture of the fish fillet dinner displayed at the entrance was not the same when i got the food, it was much smaller portion. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 2 more reviews by daren33 for Hong Kong kerinlkw hong kong Senior Reviewer 6 reviews “Efficient service, mediocre food n environment” Reviewed June 22, 2012 Just a place to stuff yrself at an affordable price Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 5 more reviews by kerinlkw for Hong Kong klaus_biesel Cebu Senior Contributor 22 reviews Reviews in 8 cities 12 helpful votes “Reasonable prices fast good sevrice” Reviewed June 19, 2012 We really were impressed how fast and fresh the meals were served. Compared to MC Donalds this self serve Restaurant is just as good as a 3 star restaurant. Their menu changes from breakfast over lunch to dinner. We saved a lot of time and money while eating there. Chinese affordable fast food, freshly prepared, served hot, nice interior. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 3 more reviews by klaus_biesel for Hong Kong Jeremy H Hong Kong, China Contributor 14 reviews 1 helpful vote “Famous but deteriorating” Reviewed June 14, 2012 It is famous for local fast foods but I must say quality is deteriorating and the price keeps silently going up. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 13 more reviews by Jeremy H for Hong Kong li h Hong Kong, China Reviewer 3 reviews “Restaurant Chain : Simply doesnt worth that.” Reviewed June 12, 2012 If you want to get the idea of how normal Hong Kong workers eat, that's where you will go. The food is really international with hotpots to french toast but it's really not taste so good but give it a shot if you JUST want to get the Hong Kong style life in your''relaxing''holiday. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 2 more reviews by li h for Hong Kong lowsweeheng Singapore Contributor 12 reviews Reviews in 5 cities 9 helpful votes “For a fuss free meal” Reviewed June 7, 2012 If you are looking for a quick economic meal at any time of day, you can't go wrong with this chain which is everywhere in Hong Kong. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review?
